questions.title: My first question
questions.description: How to ensure security of data during disaster recovery replication in AWS Elastic disaster recovery

choices.title: Data encryption at rest using AWS KMS

helpfulResource.displayText: Ensure all disaster recovery data is encrypted at rest using KMS.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement AWS KMS encryption for all data replicated during disaster recovery to protect sensitive information.

choices.title: Data encryption in transit using TLS

helpfulResource.displayText: Use TLS to secure data in transit.

improvementPlan.displayText: Set up encryption for all data transferred between regions during disaster recovery using TLS protocols to ensure secure transit.

questions.title: My second question
questions.description: What measures have been implemented to protect acess to disaster recovery resources using IAM

choices.title: Use of IAM roles and least privilege

helpfulResource.displayText: Grant the least privilege needed to perform a task.

improvementPlan.displayText: Audit current IAM policies and adjust them to follow the least privilege principle, ensuring disaster recovery resources are only accessible to authorized users.

choices.title: Use of multi-factor authentication (MFA) for privileged accounts

helpfulResource.displayText: Enable MFA for all privileged accounts.

improvementPlan.displayText: Enforce MFA on all IAM users with elevated privileges who can access disaster recovery operations.

questions.title: My third question
questions.description: How to protect disaster recovery operations from unauthorised network access

choices.title: Securing VPC subnets using security groups and network ACLs

helpfulResource.displayText: Use security groups and NACLs to restrict access.

improvementPlan.displayText: Regularly audit VPC security groups and network ACLs to ensure only authorized traffic is allowed to access disaster recovery resources.

choices.title: Enabling AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF) for critical applications

helpfulResource.displayText: Use WAF to protect disaster recovery interfaces from attacks.

improvementPlan.displayText: Deploy AWS WAF to filter and monitor HTTP and HTTPS requests to web applications involved in disaster recovery operations.

questions.title: My fourth question
questions.description: Which monitoring and alert mechanisms to use to detect security threats in disaster recovery operations

choices.title: Enabling AWS CloudTrail for auditing API calls

helpfulResource.displayText: Enable CloudTrail logging for all disaster recovery operations.

improvementPlan.displayText: Ensure CloudTrail is enabled for every region and resource involved in disaster recovery, and regularly review logs for suspicious activity.

choices.title: Using Amazon GuardDuty to detect threats in disaster recovery environments

helpfulResource.displayText: Use GuardDuty to monitor and alert on threats.

improvementPlan.displayText: Enable GuardDuty across all AWS accounts and regions to continuously monitor for anomalies and potential security breaches in disaster recovery operations.

questions.title: My fifth question
questions.description: How to ensure business continuity by securing backups and disaster recovery data in AWS

choices.title: Backing up data using AWS Backup with encryption

helpfulResource.displayText: Use AWS Backup with encryption for disaster recovery data.

improvementPlan.displayText: Configure AWS Backup with encryption enabled for all backups related to disaster recovery, ensuring data is secure even during an event.

choices.title: Enforcing strict IAM access controls on backup resources

helpfulResource.displayText: Implement least privilege access to backup resources.

improvementPlan.displayText: Review and update IAM policies to ensure that only authorized users can access and modify backup configurations and data.

questions.title: My sixth question
questions.description: Network security mechanisms to implement that ensure disaster recovery traffic and communications between AWS services

choices.title: Using AWS Shield to protect against DDoS attacks

helpfulResource.displayText: Enable AWS Shield to protect disaster recovery traffic.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implement AWS Shield Standard or Advanced to safeguard disaster recovery resources from DDoS attacks.

choices.title: Configuring VPC security groups and NACLs for disaster recovery traffic

helpfulResource.displayText: Configure security groups and NACLs for all disaster recovery traffic.

improvementPlan.displayText: Regularly review and update security group and NACL rules to ensure that only necessary traffic is allowed between disaster recovery resources.
